channel.title: Activision Reveals MW3 Subscription Plans
channel.description:
[quote] "Activision has denied it and denied it, but now it's been revealed – Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 will feature an online service (that's what Call of Duty Elite is), complete with monthly subscription fees. 'Activision executives said they haven't yet figured out how much to charge for the service, but they expect the cost to be less than fees for comparable online-entertainment services, such as a $7.99-a-month Netflix Inc. movie subscription. Portions of the service will be free, including features inspired by Facebook Inc. that will let Call of Duty players meet for online gun battles with others who share various affiliations and interests. Another feature of the service will give Call of Duty players tools, modeled on those from stock-trading websites, to analyze their performance within the game, gauging factors such as which weapons have been most successful for them in killing enemies.'" [/quote] [url]https://www.gamepron.com/news/2011/05/30/activision-reveals-call-of-duty-subscription-plans/[/url]
:rage:

item.title: Activision Reveals MW3 Subscription Plans
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

There is no sign of cods demand declining. It should be noted that most of the complaints come from people who aren’t CoDs target audience. Do you honestly think Activison cares what an actual gamer thinks of CoD? No, they aren’t targeting people who know things about games, they are getting people who just drawn in by ads. The new cod games aren’t meant for legitimate gamers, us complaining about them is like an adult complaining that children’s movies don’t entertain them. Why should Infinity Ward put effort into a game who’s players aren’t going to notice a difference?

For all the flack you’re getting, I gotta admit you make a good point. I stand more or less corrected.

Though legitimate may not be the best word, I get what your saying. It’s more of the difference between casualfag and enthusiast. Like an ordinary person who drinks wine at parties versus someone who owns a winery and dedicates many hours to tasting wine.

Read full topic

item.description:
Kairouseki:

Children’s movies can be entertaining for adults. Your argument is invalid.

Yes they can, and call of duty can be entertaining for gamers who have a clue (not as much as other games but still). Your argument is invalid. A screw driver is made for screws but you can still use it to hammer nails however since it wasn’t made to hammer nails there isn’t much room to complain about how it doesn’t do that well.

item.title: Activision Reveals MW3 Subscription Plans
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

hhhaahaha…oh wait you’re akshuly serious

I don’t mean it like there is someone who can and can’t be a gamer or whatever. Its just difficult to describe someone who has fucking clue with gameing without having to type a lot.

Like any other product there are people who know, understand and can recognize quality better than others. Its in the car industry, the housing industry, electronic industries and the various entertainment industries.

There are those who know the difference between something good and bad, and there are those who don’t have a clue and get exploited by the business. Activison is targeting the latter of gaming consumers. Gamer is a pretty broad term so I used legitimate a a descriptor to define a gamer who is also an educated consumer.

Read full topic

item.title: Activision Reveals MW3 Subscription Plans
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
garrthbarrttinn:

Do you seriously think I give a fuck whether or not it’s a sound business strategy? In what world could that possibly matter to the consumer?

EDIT: and really, I don’t think it is that sound a business strategy. Cashcows dry up unless you turn them into something more. With Guitar Hero dead BF3 coming up and complaints rising (mostly among pc gamers), Activision should be more worried about keeping it’s customers around than charging them more.

There is no sign of cods demand declining. It should be noted that most of the complaints come from people who aren’t CoDs target audience. Do you honestly think Activison cares what an actual gamer thinks of CoD? No, they aren’t targeting people who know things about games, they are getting people who just drawn in by ads. The new cod games aren’t meant for legitimate gamers, us complaining about them is like an adult complaining that children’s movies don’t entertain them. Why should Infinity Ward put effort into a game who’s players aren’t going to notice a difference?

Read full topic

item.title: Activision Reveals MW3 Subscription Plans
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

TL;DR Activion is big business, it makes decisions on traditional business strategies and doesn’t care if informed consumers (you me and most real gamers) dislike it because they represent the minority of their target audience.

Do you seriously think I give a fuck whether or not it’s a sound business strategy? In what world could that possibly matter to the consumer?

EDIT: and really, I don’t think it is that sound a business strategy. Cashcows dry up unless you turn them into something more. With Guitar Hero dead BF3 coming up and complaints rising (mostly among pc gamers), Activision should be more worried about keeping it’s customers around than charging them more.

Read full topic
